screenshot.alt: Screenshot of a .tax2020 file in Intuit TurboTax 2020
screenshot.caption: TAX2020 file open in Intuit TurboTax 2020

description: TurboTax is a tax return application used to prepare and file U.S. Federal and State tax returns. It is available as a downloadable desktop version for Windows and macOS, and as a web version called TurboTax Online.

You will most likely only encounter a TAX2020 file if you are using the desktop version of TurboTax to prepare your taxes and want to save your progress. However, you may also download a TAX2020 file from TurboTax Online when you export your tax information.
To create a TAX2020 file with the desktop version of TurboTax, select File → Save... , choose your save options, then click Save .
To export a TAX2020 file from TurboTax Online, click Tax Tools → Tools then select "Save your 2020 return to your computer," which initiates the download of the TAX2020 file ( taxReturn.tax2020 ).

After downloading the TAX2020 file, you can open it with the desktop version of TurboTax. Keep in mind that if you make any modifications to the return in TurboTax Online, the changes will not be synced to the TAX2020 file and must be exported again.

If you have a .TAX2019 file with return information prepared by the 2019 version of TurboTax you can import it in the 2020 desktop version of TurboTax. To do this, select "Use a tax return that's on my computer" when prompted at the beginning of the tax return process, then select the TAX2019 file.
NOTE: TAX2020 files are typically created in 2021 since annual tax returns are filed for the previous year.

common_filenames.description: Tax Return 20.tax2020 - Default name given to a new TAX2020 file created by TurboTax.
taxReturn.tax2020 - Default name given to a TAX2020 file downloaded from TurboTax Online.
